thread.title: Donald Trump's 'Muslim ban' temporarily BLOCKED by federal judge triggering travel CHAOS
thread.title_full: Donald Trump's 'Muslim ban' temporarily BLOCKED by federal judge triggering travel CHAOS

title: Donald Trump's 'Muslim ban' temporarily BLOCKED by federal judge triggering travel CHAOS
text:
Washington Attorney General Bob Ferguson said he would “make sure” the President upholds the ruling.He said: “The Constitution prevailed today. No one is above the law – not even the President.“It’s our President’s duty to honour this ruling and I’ll make sure he does.” GETTY The President's executive order has been temporarily blocked nationwide. GETTY The ban has been met with protests across the globe. 
The ruling is the broadest challenge against the President’s executive order to date and was filed by Mr Ferguson three days after Trump signed the order.The suit argued the travel ban violates constitutional rights of immigrants and their families.More than 50 lawsuits have been filed against the ban so far – but Judge Robart’s is the first to issue a nationwide injunction. The UK Reacts To Trump's 'Muslim' Travel Ban Mon, January 30, 2017 President Trump signed an executive order banning immigration to the USA from seven 'muslim' countries. This led to protests across America and, now, the UK. PA 1 of 11 People demonstrate during a protest at Downing Street in central London against US President Donald Trump's controversial travel ban on refugees and people from seven mainly-Muslim countries 
The move comes amid claims that more than 100,000 people could have been affected by Trump’s directive .But the President used his weekly address to give a fiery defence of the order.He said: “I will never forget that my responsibility is to keep you – the American people – safe and free. 
“The executive order established a process to develop new vetting and mechanisms to ensure those coming into America love and support our people. That they have good intentions.”The President also touched on the rapid growth of the US job market and Black History month during the address.He added: “On every single front, we are working to deliver for American workers and American families.” Related articles
